question.title: ANR errors - SCREEN OFF - How am I supposed to handle them?

node.contents: I've received same output for my own game and I couldn't understand a single thing there. So I chose to ignore it. Invest your time on ANR errors if they are too frequent, or else just ignore them.

astNode.text: I've received same output for my own game and I couldn't understand a single thing there. So I chose to ignore it. Invest your time on ANR errors if they are too frequent, or else just ignore them.

node.contents: I got this message on the developer console stating that my application had frozen because of:

astNode.text: I got this message on the developer console stating that my application had frozen because of:

node.contents: There was no stack trace because this was raised by a pre-Froyo user. It doesn't even tell me which activity within my application caused the error - although I'd guess it was my Game activity.

astNode.text: There was no stack trace because this was raised by a pre-Froyo user. It doesn't even tell me which activity within my application caused the error - although I'd guess it was my Game activity.

node.contents: This also matches my own experience that sometimes when my phone is running low on battery that my application will just freeze and has to be killed.

astNode.text: This also matches my own experience that sometimes when my phone is running low on battery that my application will just freeze and has to be killed.

node.contents: Is there something that I'm supposed to be doing within my activities to handle this freeze state?

astNode.text: Is there something that I'm supposed to be doing within my activities to handle this freeze state?

node.contents: I've now got some proper output from the market but I still don't know what to do with it.

astNode.text: I've now got some proper output from the market but I still don't know what to do with it.

node.contents: Android will display the ANR dialog for a particular application when it detects one of the following conditions: • No response to an input event (e.g. key press, screen touch) within 5 seconds. • A BroadcastReceiver hasn't finished executing within 10 seconds.
